question: 戻す
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>return</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to return</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to return something</vocabulary>. You know you're doing the action of returning someone or something because when you do, they just <reading>sue</reading> (<ja>す</ja>) you because you broke the thing you were supposed to return before returning it.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the same as what you learned with the kanji.
